alert.note: Alert for Chaves; De Baca; Guadalupe; Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 1:33PM MST until February 26 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Eastern Lincoln County in central New Mexico... Western De Baca County in east central New Mexico... Western Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico... Southwestern Guadalupe County in east central New Mexico... * Until 300 PM MST. * At 130 PM MST, a dust storm extended from the Ruidoso area northeast toward Vaughn and east toward Yeso as well as the Roswell area. Low visibilities in blowing dust due to very strong to damaging winds will continue to spread north and eastward. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 79 and 204. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 265 and 316. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 78 and 161. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Ruidoso, Vaughn, Lincoln, Ruidoso Downs, Capitan, Encinoso, Elk, Fort Stanton and San Patricio. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
